content.description: A scientist is investigating whether percent concentration can be used to predict density in apple juice. A scientist selected a random sample of 12 apple juice varieties and recorded the density, in pounds per cubic inch, and the percent concentration of each apple juice variety. The scientist wants to estimate the mean change in the density, in pounds per cubic inch, for each increase of 1 percent concentration of apple juice.
content.question: Assuming the conditions for inference have been met, which of the following inference procedures is most appropriate for this investigation?

choices.label: A linear regression <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for slope
A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a mean difference
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between means
A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for means
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between proportions

content.answer: A linear regression <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for slope

topic.text: 9.2: Confidence Intervals for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate inference method for confidence intervals.
